material.mattext: The summer for the Northern Hemisphere is when the Northern Hemisphere is [91a70ce4-dc27-4fc2-a4f1-cb42c6d0fbde] the sun.
What angle, in degrees, is the inclination of the Earth's axis to the plane of its orbit from a line that is perpendicular to that plane?
What is the latitude, in degrees North, of an observer who measures the Sun's altitude of `d`° above the southern horizon at noon on the summer solstice?
Math the following descriptions of Earth's motion

What is the age of a `a`-year-old person in sidereal days? Answer to the nearest full day.

1 yr = 365.24220 msd

1 yr = 366.243 daysidereal

What season is it in North America as shown by the Earth's position in the image below? The dashed circle represents Earth's orbital plane and the center star is the Sun.

Note: the Sun and Earth are not drawn to scale.
